intro: Verbena gracilescens var. gracilescens, commonly known as slender verbena, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually blue to purple in color, arranged in spikes. It prefers full sun and well-drained soil, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Its drought tolerance and ability to attract pollinators make it a valuable addition to native plant gardens.
